title: Every bonus earned by NCAA football coaches in Football Bowl Subdivision so far this season
text:
CLOSE

The college football season is progressing, and so are the bonus earnings of head coaches that will end up as the largest part of incentive payouts schools also will make to assistant coaches, strength coaches, and — at some schools — to athletics directors and a range of team staffers.

For the first time, USA TODAY Sports is tracking on a weekly basis the amounts public-school football head coaches are scheduled to be getting and for what achievements. The information is based on contracts USA TODAY Sports obtained from the schools through open-records requests and is updated through the games of Oct. 12.

Alabama: Nick Saban

$65,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Appalachian State: Eliah Drinkwitz

$10,000: Play at home stadium of Power Five team in guarantee game (North Carolina)

***

Boise State: Bryan Harsin

$25,000: Regular-season win over Power Five team (Florida State)

$35,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Connecticut: Randy Edsall

$26,000: Win any game (Wagner), plus at least eight single-game statistical bonuses at $2,000 each

$6,000: three single-game stat bonuses at $2,000 each

$4,000: two single-game stat bonuses at $2,000 each

$2,000: one single-game stat bonus at $2,000 each

$2,000: one single-game stat bonus at $2,000 each

***

Florida: Dan Mullen

$100,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Hawaii: Nick Rolovich

$7,500: Regular-season home win over Power Five team (Arizona)

$7,500: Regular-season home win over Power Five team (Oregon State)

***

Minnesota: P.J. Fleck

$75,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Missouri: Barry Odom

$5,000: Team in top 25 of AP media poll

***

Oklahoma: Lincoln Riley

$25,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Penn State: James Franklin

$200,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

San Diego State: Rocky Long

$10,000: Win over Power Five team (UCLA)

***

Utah: Kyle Whittingham

$15,000: Team in top 25 of Amway Coaches’ or AP media poll in preseason or during season

***

Wisconsin: Paul Chryst

Share of staff bonus pool now worth nearly $100,000: Sixth win, eligible for non-CFP bowl game

***

Wyoming: Craig Bohl

$100,000: Regular-season win over Power Five team (Missouri)

***
description: NCAA football coaches have started cashing in on bonuses in their contracts. Here's a full list of those earned by Football Bowl Subdivision coaches.
